required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study Of Ambulatory Monitoring System
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study Of Ambulatory Monitoring System

brief_summary.textblock: This is a clinical, data collection study conducted at one site. This study will collect open comments, user feedback and parameter raw data to support patient monitoring product development. Subjects participating in this study will be monitored with the site's standard of care primary monitor and the investigational device as the secondary monitor while enrolled in this study. No subject care decisions or diagnoses will be made based on information obtained from the investigational secondary monitor.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a pre-market, open label, prospective, non-randomized, data collection clinical research study conducted at one investigational site. This study will collect open comments, user feedback and parameter raw data to support product development. Raw parameter data will be collected from electrocardiogram (ECG), Pulse Rate (PR), respiratory rate (RR), peripheral capillary oxygen saturation (SpO2), non-invasive blood pressure (NIBP), and temperature. Subjects participating in this study will be monitored with the site's standard of care primary monitor and the investigational device as the secondary monitor while enrolled in this study. No subject care decisions or diagnoses will be made based on information obtained from the investigational secondary monitor.
Participation is expected to last no more than 72 hours.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, average of one day per subject
primary_outcome.description: This is an early feasibility study intended to elicit user feedback in a hospital setting in order to improve device functionality and further development of the measurement algorithms. User feedback will be collected by open comments field in CRF.
Electronic device files from patient sensors will be collected for each subject.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion and issues resolved, average of one day per subject
secondary_outcome.description: To collect safety information, including type and number of AEs, SAEs, and device issues.

arm_group.description: The evaluable device (Ambulatory Monitoring Solution and its parts) is a secondary monitoring device and no decisions/diagnosis will be made from these devices.

intervention.description: Aim is to evaluate PR; RR; NIBP, cNIBP, SpO2 and arterial blood pressure with investigational Ambulatory Monitoring Solution (AMS)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Are able to provide written informed consent or have a legally designated representative provide written informed consent;
2. Are being cared for in a hospital unit and are expected to remain in the unit for the duration of the study procedure; AND
3. Are an adult 18 years or older, or pediatric or neonate subject.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Are known to be pregnant;
2. Are breastfeeding; OR
3. Are suffering from infections that require isolation.

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital District of Helsinki and Uusimaa
